alert.note: Alert for Banner; Morrill; Scotts Bluff (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 9:51PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Box Butte, east central Scotts Bluff, northwestern Morrill and northeastern Banner Counties through 930 PM MDT... At 851 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bayard, or 23 miles southeast of Scottsbluff, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bayard, Chimney Rock State Park, Moomaws Corner, Angora, The Intersection Of Highway 385 And L62, South Bayard Junction and McGrew. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
